alert.note: Alert for St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:13AM CST until February 18 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, Monroe and Saint Clair. Portions of east central Missouri, including the following counties and independent city, Jefferson, Saint Louis and Saint Louis City. * WHEN...Until 815 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Louis, Belleville, Kirkwood, East St. Louis, Collinsville, Webster Groves, Arnold, Fairview Heights, Clayton, Cahokia, Crestwood, Columbia, Richmond Heights, Sunset Hills, Brentwood, Maplewood, Valley Park, Shrewsbury, Glendale and Centreville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
